subtitle.line: MY FAVOURITE SEASON
MY FAVOURITE SEASON

line.words: Mada Adams, pwofesè timoun yo, di yo, “Jodi a, mwen vle ke nou pale m de sezon nou pi renmen an.” “Prentan an se nan mwa mas, avril, epi me. Kimoun ki renmen prentan?§

subtitle.line: “Today, I want you to tell me about your favourite season” says the children’s teacher, Mrs Adams. “Spring is in March, April and May. Who likes spring?”
“Today, I want you to tell me about your favourite season” says the children’s teacher, Mrs Adams. “Spring is in March, April and May. Who likes spring?”

line.words: Sinita reponn “Mwen renmen prentan. Nan prentan, solèy la klere, epi li fè cho. Mwen renmen flè nasis jòn ak woz. Mwen renmen ti poul ak ti mouton tou”.

subtitle.line: “I like spring” says Sunita. “In spring it is warm and sunny. My favourite flowers are yellow daffodils and pink blossom. I also like chicks and lambs.”
“I like spring” says Sunita. “In spring it is warm and sunny. My favourite flowers are yellow daffodils and pink blossom. I also like chicks and lambs.”

line.words: Pyè di, “Mwen renmen prentan tou. Mwen renmen pak, paske pandan pak mwen manje anpil ze. Ti Lapen pak la enteresan!”

subtitle.line: “I also like spring,” says Peter. “I like Easter because I have lots of Easter eggs to eat. And the Easter bunny is fun!”
“I also like spring,” says Peter. “I like Easter because I have lots of Easter eggs to eat. And the Easter bunny is fun!”

line.words: Madan Adams di, “Lete se nan mwa jen, jiyè, epi out. Kimoun ki renmen lete?”

subtitle.line: “Summer is in June, July and August. Who likes summer?” asks Mrs Adams.
“Summer is in June, July and August. Who likes summer?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: Maria reponn, “Mwen renmen lete. Mwen kontan anpil paske n al wè gran mwen an Espay. Gen anpil solèy epi li fè cho. Syèl la ble, e flè yo koulè vyolèt”.

subtitle.line: “I like summer,” says Maria. “I am very excited because we visit my gran in Spain. It is very hot and sunny. The sky is blue and the flowers are purple.”
“I like summer,” says Maria. “I am very excited because we visit my gran in Spain. It is very hot and sunny. The sky is blue and the flowers are purple.”

line.words: Madan Adams di, “Lotòn se an septanm, Oktòb, ak novanm.” Kimoun ki renmen lotòn?”

subtitle.line: “Autumn is in September, October and November. Who likes autumn?” asks Mrs Adams.
“Autumn is in September, October and November. Who likes autumn?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: Abdoul reponn, “Mwen renmen lòtòn. Li fè yon tijan frèt ak anpil van, men l gen anpil koulè tou. Mwen renmen fèy wouj ak jòn yo.”

subtitle.line: “I like autumn,” says Abdul. “It is quite cold and windy, but it is very colourful. I like the red and yellow leaves.”
“I like autumn,” says Abdul. “It is quite cold and windy, but it is very colourful. I like the red and yellow leaves.”

line.words: Madan Adams di, “Livè se an desanm, janvye ak fevriye. Kimoun ki renmen livè?”

subtitle.line: “Winter is in December, January and February. Who likes winter?” asks Mrs Adams.
“Winter is in December, January and February. Who likes winter?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: Sara reponn, “Mwen renmen livè. N al wè matant mwen k ap viv an Polòy. Li fè frèt anpil, men gen anpil bèl nèj blan.”

subtitle.line: “I like winter,” says Klara. “We visit my auntie in Poland. It is very cold but there is lots of beautiful white snow.”
“I like winter,” says Klara. “We visit my auntie in Poland. It is very cold but there is lots of beautiful white snow.”

line.words: Madan Adams di, “Stiven, ki sezon w pi renmen?”

subtitle.line: “What is your favourite season, Steven?” asks Mrs Adams.
“What is your favourite season, Steven?” asks Mrs Adams.

line.words: Stiven reponn, “Mwen pa gen yon sezon m pi renmen. Te gen bèl tan o prentan, men te gen anpil lapli. Te gen solèy nan lete, men li te fè cho anpil.§

subtitle.line: “I don’t have a favourite season,” says Steven. “It was good weather in spring, but it was very rainy. It was sunny in summer, but it was very hot.§
“I don’t have a favourite season,” says Steven. “It was good weather in spring, but it was very rainy. It was sunny in summer, but it was very hot.§

line.words: §Nan lotòn, tan an te bèl, men te gen anpil van. Tan an te move nan livè, paske syèl la te tou nwè epi li te fè frèt anpil.”

subtitle.line: §It was quite good weather in autumn, but it was windy. And it was bad weather in winter because the sky was grey and it was very cold.”
§It was quite good weather in autumn, but it was windy. And it was bad weather in winter because the sky was grey and it was very cold.”

line.words: Madan Adams di, “Mwen espere w ap renmen sezon yo lane pwochèn, Tòm!” “Se pa vre, Stiven?§

subtitle.line: “I hope you like the seasons next year, Tom!” says Mrs Adams.Isn’t it Steven?
“I hope you like the seasons next year, Tom!” says Mrs Adams.Isn’t it Steven?
